subject: Re: [junit] Eclipse: No tests found with test runner 'JUnit 4'
msgSnippet: ... Well, this project currently has 12 maven modules (plus som packaging modules) and it s far easier just to have a naming convention that everyone sticks to
messageBody:
m√•n 2008-12-15 klockan 21:36 -0500 skrev David Saff:
> Fredrik,
>
> I had forgotten DirectorySuiteBuilder. In general, I really like having a
> single class that describes the tests I want to run--it makes things much
> easier when I want to run things from the command line, or ant, or my
> continuous build, or...
>
> David Saff

Well, this project currently has 12 maven modules (plus som packaging
modules) and it's far easier just to have a naming convention that
everyone sticks to and have the framework do the rest.
Putting tests into a TestSuite class is considered just administration
overhead that adds no value to the project.

I guess we'll have to put two DirectorySuiteBuilder classes in each
module that has unit and integration tests.

Thanks for your replies.

Still open for suggestions like "you could easily fix the eclipse plugin
by looking at the files in org.eclipse.....". :)
Perhaps I should go about and file a bug/request report (or vote for an
existing one).

/
Fredrik


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
